SparedIsobel_SD.synopsis: The Dark Urge finds the Butler at their bedside after failing to kill Isobel. They are faced with the urge to kill, instead, whatever character has the highest approval to them (or their romantic partner, if they have one).Some characters are excluded from this murder.
SparedIsobel_SD.how_to_trigger: Queue the Spared Isobel night from debug book;For testing with a specific character - add that character and raise their approval. If there are not party members, Gale will be added.

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands.synopsis: Dark Urge wakes up and has bloody hands
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands.how_to_trigger: Queue Camp Night NIGHT_DarkUrge_MurderOfAlfiraEnd the DayGo to Bed

Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld.synopsis: The Dark Urge sees themselves and Orin in the Bhaal temple. Only one of them is given the Slayer form. The Butler of Bhaal is not present, but is the one giving the voiceover and information about what is happening. The icon of Bhaal looms over all. We see spectres of those we have had to kill, if we were on the Embracing track.If we turn into the Slayer, it should automatically start the dialogue after this with Jaheira, if present, talking about the Slayer.

ButlerIntro_SD.synopsis: The Butler appears, after the Alfira scene has resolved, and introduces himself.
ButlerIntro_SD.how_to_trigger: Queue Butler Intro night with the Dark Urge in party;Sleep

Bloodwedding_SD.synopsis: The Dark Urge sees themselves and Orin in the Bhaal temple. Only one of them is given the Slayer form. The Butler of Bhaal is not present, but is the one giving the voiceover and information about what is happening. The icon of Bhaal looms over all. We see spectres of those we have had to kill, if we were on the Embracing track.If we turn into the Slayer, it should automatically start the dialogue after this with Jaheira, if present, talking about the Slayer.

SkippedTempleFinale_SD.synopsis: The Dark Urge missed Orin's defeat or lost the duel.
SkippedTempleFinale_SD.how_to_trigger: Play with Dark Urge in the party.Queue SkippedTempleFinale night.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_40.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_40.text: Good evening, Master! Oh, I am inundated with relief, having finally found your vile self.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_55.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_55.text: Although, after I found the bard's body, I was waylaid. Awestruck, I sat, admiring the work night and day.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_57.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_57.text: But I saved the gall bladder as a memento of your talent. It's tucked safely inside my breast pocket.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_2.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_2.text: Hope you don't mind - I know you always told me not to stand too close to art when it's on display.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_78.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_78.text: Oh, where are my manners - you've forgotten me, haven't you? Sceleritas Fel. Your undyingly loyal Butler.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_47.text: What do you mean you're my Butler?!

IsobelKillOrder_SD_76.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_76.text: I also tend to your grounds, manage your estate, arrange murder victims for you to systematically brutalise, and serve dinner.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_24.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_24.text: Although I must apologise: dinner is nowhere near ready tonight. For we are far behind on our murder schedule.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_48.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_48.text: Good evening, Master! I'm ever-relieved to have found you at last, for you've been shirking your duties!

IsobelKillOrder_SD_65.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_65.text: A fine fellow of your gruelling station must continue to show the innocent masses what-for.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_37.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_37.text: I arranged a perfect crime for you: the sweet little girl Alfira was to place herself in your knife's way.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_71.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_71.text: But ooh, poor itching one, your little indisposition has made you absent-minded indeed if you didn't notice.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_54.speaker: Narrator
IsobelKillOrder_SD_54.text: *Your thoughts are back on the twisted Sceleritas and his honeyed words of violence.*
IsobelKillOrder_SD_54.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Butler looms over the Tav's bedrool. TAV does not notice him, but they are trying hard to sleep.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_15.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: TAV notices that the Butler has been above them while they were thinking this.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_60.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_60.text: Hells! Can you read my thoughts?

IsobelKillOrder_SD_23.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_23.text: I don't need to. They are all the same.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_50.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_50.text: There is but one thing on your mind. And it won't go away, until your thirsty Urge is sated.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_34.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_34.text: I come here, for I wish to bring you another powerful tithe.
IsobelKillOrder_SD_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: The avatar awakens and stands up.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_5.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_5.text: I come here, for I wish to bring you a powerful tithe.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_4.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_4.text: But I cannot grant you this prize quite yet. You must do something divinely unspeakable first.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_22.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_22.text: The reward will titillate your twitching Urge, in preparation for the rest of your inheritance to come.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_45.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_45.text: You will receive a royal prize for killing this pretty girl.
IsobelKillOrder_SD_45.context: CinematicNodeContext: BUTLER conjurs a spectral vision of Isobel with a wave of a clawNodeContext: BUTLER conjurs a spectral vision of Isobel with a wave of a claw

IsobelKillOrder_SD_0.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_0.text: Isobel: the cleric with the sweetest face of the Moon.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_43.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_43.text: She is too precious to live.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_19.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_19.text: I won't let myself touch another innocent.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_77.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_77.text: I felt the desire to kill her so strongly when we met...

IsobelKillOrder_SD_18.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_18.text: What has she done to deserve such a fate?

IsobelKillOrder_SD_33.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_33.text: Why, the greatest crime of them all: nothing at all!

IsobelKillOrder_SD_56.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_56.text: Fear not. Her death will fill an entire village with piles of bodies.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_70.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_70.text: I might be willing. Is there a catch?

IsobelKillOrder_SD_7.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_7.text: No catch at all. You will get to see the beautiful sight of an entire village filled with bodies.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_44.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_44.text: You adore piles of bodies, Master. They have always been your favourite.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_21.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_21.text: Give in to the rush of joy that courses through you.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_36.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_36.text: Oh Master, consider the tiny mishap with the bard you had the last time we met.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_61.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_61.text: Your unconscious, clever mind hungers for extreme violence.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_66.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_66.text: Who knows who you might kill next if you do not satisfy your Urge?

IsobelKillOrder_SD_38.text: Stop talking as if you're brewing me a cup of tea! We're talking about real people!

IsobelKillOrder_SD_8.text: I'm not going to kill Isobel! Last Light is doomed without her.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_53.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_53.text: Perhaps you have failed to consider all the piles of bodies that will fill the village?

IsobelKillOrder_SD_13.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_13.text: One with the sweetest face of the moon.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_6.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_6.text: The killing is good enough fun even without a reward!

IsobelKillOrder_SD_32.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_32.text: Oh, you are such an eloquent and well-mannered Master.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_26.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_26.text: I'm sure you will breeze through these trivial little exams with great distinction.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_73.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_73.text: I kill for myself, not because you command me.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_59.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_59.text: You are such a pleasure to serve! Of course, you are killing for yourself.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_74.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_74.text: From coast to coast, our realm only exists for you to play with, after all.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_9.text: I'm not doing a thing you say! This isn't who I am.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_64.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_64.text: You have been a prodigal young Master.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_67.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_67.text: But you have not been disinherited yet. You can rule with such ease, if you follow your call.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_3.text: Haven't I done enough killing already?

IsobelKillOrder_SD_42.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_42.text: I was just lying here wishing you wouldn't come back.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_69.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_69.text: Oh! My nauseating Master! Such rudeness is unbecoming of your august station.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_62.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_62.text: It has been too long since you venerated me. You're slipping.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_68.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_68.text: Those words sting, though they are true. I vow I will say your name a thousand times in prayer before I rest tonight.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_12.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_12.text: I love you so dearly, Master.

IsobelKillOrder_SD_63.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
IsobelKillOrder_SD_63.text: Ssh. Ssh. Quiet, dear depraved one. We wouldn't want to wake the others. They would be so jealous.

SparedIsobel_SD_70.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_70.text: *Your stomach churns around and around. The bile within is unsettled. Each moment brings a new surge.*
SparedIsobel_SD_70.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Dark Urge is trying to sleep or rest, wakes up and starts pacing around a quiet part of the camp.

SparedIsobel_SD_55.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_55.text: *Your companions sleep like blissful lumps of meat.*
SparedIsobel_SD_55.context: CinematicNodeContext: The BUTLER appears in this shot, beside the body of the Dark Urge's favourite companion.

SparedIsobel_SD_36.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_36.text: He is an insult to the name of devils, posing as a monster with that sickly good heart.
SparedIsobel_SD_36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Butler is crouched low beside the sleeping companion.

SparedIsobel_SD_65.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_65.text: You could do so much better, Master.
SparedIsobel_SD_65.context: CinematicNodeContext: Butler is crouched low beside the sleeping companion.

SparedIsobel_SD_210.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_210.text: Have you forgotten? Whenever this frail carcass perishes, you shall always be sent a fresh Sceleritas.

SparedIsobel_SD_178.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_178.text: You must have killed me hundreds of times since you were a youngling. I hope there will be hundreds more...

SparedIsobel_SD_98.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_98.text: I won't lay so much as a talon on her. I wouldn't rob you of that delight.
SparedIsobel_SD_98.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] The Butler rises to his feet, and lightly hops over the sleeping companion and bows in a groveling nature.

SparedIsobel_SD_32.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_32.text: What in the Hells do you want?

SparedIsobel_SD_195.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_195.text: I am here to watch your moment of triumph, my loathly Master.
SparedIsobel_SD_195.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] The Butler rises to his feet, and lightly hops over the sleeping companion and bows in a groveling nature.

SparedIsobel_SD_44.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_44.text: Cease this insubordination. You serve me.

SparedIsobel_SD_94.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_94.text: I am but an eager messenger, from the depths of your dirty thoughts.
SparedIsobel_SD_94.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] The Butler rises to his feet, and lightly hops over the sleeping companion and bows in a groveling nature.

SparedIsobel_SD_142.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_142.text: Your clever mind is penning tragedy as we speak. Your repressed Urge yearns to kill.

SparedIsobel_SD_5.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_5.text: And kill you will. Tonight, the moment you close your eyes, your favourite person will be brutalised.

SparedIsobel_SD_117.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_117.text: I love her. No, it cannot be.

SparedIsobel_SD_22.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_22.text: We all kill what we love most, in time.

SparedIsobel_SD_187.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_187.text: She is my closest friend. It could never happen.

SparedIsobel_SD_190.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_190.text: It will be the most perfect, most brutal death in your long career. Even from before your little indisposition.

SparedIsobel_SD_92.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_92.text: No, I'll kill anyone else instead. But not one of my companions.

SparedIsobel_SD_41.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_41.text: No. I'll kill the cleric instead, if I need to kill someone.

SparedIsobel_SD_234.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_234.text: It is too late. You ignored your Urge, and now it is insatiable.

SparedIsobel_SD_203.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_203.text: I am planning to kidnap Isobel. Alive.

SparedIsobel_SD_50.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_50.text: You know there is murder slumbering within you, and in controlling it, it has grown insatiable. Your Dark Urge will have death tonight, one way or another.

SparedIsobel_SD_49.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_49.text: I didn't lay a finger on Isobel. I can control myself.

SparedIsobel_SD_220.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_220.text: It is precisely because you didn't touch her, that you are insatiable. Your Dark Urge will have death, one way or another. Tonight.

SparedIsobel_SD_202.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_202.text: You've judged my affections wrongly - I am much closer to Astarion!

SparedIsobel_SD_103.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_103.text: Then it should be a trifling matter to kill this one!

SparedIsobel_SD_233.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_233.text: She was starting to trust you. The only one she ever has. Pity it's coming to an end.

SparedIsobel_SD_67.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_67.text: She must live - I haven't yet told her how I truly feel about her.

SparedIsobel_SD_135.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_135.text: Why not whisper it while you twist a knife? Or have a love confession be the final words between you?

SparedIsobel_SD_124.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_124.text: We are indomitable together. You underestimate us.

SparedIsobel_SD_10.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_10.text: You are wrong to consider another your equal.

SparedIsobel_SD_1.text: Have you been watching us while we are together?

SparedIsobel_SD_95.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_95.text: It is my duty to ensure you are making the right decisions, Master.

SparedIsobel_SD_155.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_155.text: There was much disappointment at your reluctance to kill the little Moonmaiden.

SparedIsobel_SD_7.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_7.text: You could kill this one deliberately. I'm sure it will be considered a great show of good will. The tithe could still be yours.

SparedIsobel_SD_201.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_201.text: I will save her, whatever it takes.

SparedIsobel_SD_39.text: There's no chance in the Hells I'm going to kill my companion.

SparedIsobel_SD_132.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_132.text: I do not doubt you will act with the decorum befitting one of your rank.

SparedIsobel_SD_172.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_172.text: *Your companion rests blissfully, without a fear in the world.*

SparedIsobel_SD_0.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_0.text: Reach forward to shake her shoulder and wake her.

SparedIsobel_SD_21.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_21.text: *As your hand approaches her body, it wavers. It longs to close around her throat.*
SparedIsobel_SD_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reaches out their hand, but hesitates.

SparedIsobel_SD_45.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_45.text: Surrender to the Urge. Do your worst.

SparedIsobel_SD_99.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_99.text: Hmm...? Oh, has the mood struck you, love? I suppose we could try, if you think the others won't stir...
SparedIsobel_SD_99.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] The Companion awakens from their sleep.Choose an appropraite start sleeping position for character, sit up during line

SparedIsobel_SD_97.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_97.text: Hold on, you look like you've had a shock - is something the matter?
SparedIsobel_SD_97.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Greg] DU has a woozy expression.Companion should be in the sitting up pose after waking

SparedIsobel_SD_170.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_170.text: Now isn't the time. I need to protect you.

SparedIsobel_SD_68.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_68.text: A wicked wretch came to me in the night, and told me something horrible.

SparedIsobel_SD_93.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_93.text: Well, could be worse... It could have done something horrible. What did it say?
SparedIsobel_SD_93.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Greg] DU has a woozy expression.Companion should be in the sitting up pose after waking

SparedIsobel_SD_162.text: You are in a lot of danger. We need to act fast.

SparedIsobel_SD_71.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_71.text: All right, I'm awake. Tell me everything.
SparedIsobel_SD_71.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Greg] DU has a woozy expression.Companion should be in the sitting up pose after waking

SparedIsobel_SD_105.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_105.text: *As you tell your story, fatigue fills your body. Your head swims with the worst headache you've known.*
SparedIsobel_SD_105.context: CinematicNodeContext: DU has a pained expression

SparedIsobel_SD_34.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_34.text: The beast that killed Alfira will call again - my possessed mind will kill you.

SparedIsobel_SD_17.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_17.text: Madness will take over my body against my will, and I will kill you.

SparedIsobel_SD_196.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_196.text: Hells, what I wouldn't give for a boring lover sometimes.
SparedIsobel_SD_196.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Greg] .Companion should be in the sitting up pose after waking

SparedIsobel_SD_80.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_80.text: How long has this been going on? Do I even want to know the answer to that...?
SparedIsobel_SD_80.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Greg]Companion should be in the sitting up pose after waking

SparedIsobel_SD_139.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_139.text: I've been cursed. When I fall asleep, I will try to murder you.

SparedIsobel_SD_76.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_76.text: I'd rather you'd trusted me sooner, given all we've been through already.
SparedIsobel_SD_76.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Greg] .Companion should be in the sitting up pose after waking

SparedIsobel_SD_231.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_231.text: Suddenly Alfira's death makes a lot more sense... We're going to figure this out, understand? We have to.
SparedIsobel_SD_231.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Greg] .Companion should be in the sitting up pose after waking

SparedIsobel_SD_53.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_53.text: Seems like some sort of curse - the last bloody thing we need. But we're going to help you through this, together.

SparedIsobel_SD_75.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_75.text: *Suddenly you become drowsy. Your vision blurs and floods with yellow bile, and you faint in a dizzy blur.*
SparedIsobel_SD_75.context:
CinematicNodeContext: DU struggling to stay awake and then faints.

Fade to black

SparedIsobel_SD_194.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_194.text: *You are not yourself. All control is gone.*
SparedIsobel_SD_194.context: CinematicNodeContext: The DU has fainted, and we now see them with their hands tied behind their back. The companion sits nearby watching them. The Dark Urge is thrashing about.

SparedIsobel_SD_175.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_175.text: You convinced me to spare Nightsong. You and I are both capable of resisting the darkness that compels us.

SparedIsobel_SD_232.text: Resist and try to express understanding.

SparedIsobel_SD_185.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_185.text: This thing won't have you. It won't win.
SparedIsobel_SD_185.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

SparedIsobel_SD_167.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_167.text: I will scoop out those watchful eyes and toss them to the dogs.

SparedIsobel_SD_184.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_184.text: I wish nothing more than to cut you up and eat you raw!

SparedIsobel_SD_108.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_108.text: No - keep back. No biting. This is worse than I thought...
SparedIsobel_SD_108.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that. companion avoid the player trying to bite themNodeContext: [Astarion: as if telling off a toddler]

SparedIsobel_SD_215.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_215.text: If you've energy to flirt, you've energy to fight this thing. Stay with me, I know you can.
SparedIsobel_SD_215.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

SparedIsobel_SD_69.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_69.text: *Your hands are raw and bloody as every inkling of your Urge yearns to tear your bindings.*

SparedIsobel_SD_225.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_225.text: Easy. You're in control. Bloodlust won't win tonight.
SparedIsobel_SD_225.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.NodeContext: [Astarion: genuinely reassuring]

SparedIsobel_SD_25.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_25.text: Your blood will clot for me like liquid rubies.

SparedIsobel_SD_137.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_137.text: Quite an imagination. Try applying it to some peaceful thoughts. I know you can.
SparedIsobel_SD_137.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

SparedIsobel_SD_200.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_200.text: The bruises I will give you shall gorge themselves on your blood.

SparedIsobel_SD_86.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_86.text: Whatever's whispering these rabid thoughts to you - block it out. Focus on me.
SparedIsobel_SD_86.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

SparedIsobel_SD_62.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_62.text: *The night passes sick and sweating, but bloodlessly.*
SparedIsobel_SD_62.context: CinematicNodeContext: The scene fades into the next morning

SparedIsobel_SD_206.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_206.text: *You once again inhabit your own mind.*

SparedIsobel_SD_72.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_72.text: Are you back to yourself...? Hells, Alfira didn't stand a chance...
SparedIsobel_SD_72.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

SparedIsobel_SD_38.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_38.text: I think some more explaining is in order. Exactly what just came over you?
SparedIsobel_SD_38.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

SparedIsobel_SD_66.text: Confess everything: you have been fiercely fighting against your Dark Urge.

SparedIsobel_SD_33.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_33.text: I'll help protect you, I promise. Seems I'll need to, just to keep myself safe.
SparedIsobel_SD_33.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

SparedIsobel_SD_128.text: I promise I will be the person you see in me.

SparedIsobel_SD_81.text: You are allowed to hate me for this.

SparedIsobel_SD_127.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_127.text: Let's save the hate for those who deserve it. This isn't your fault.
SparedIsobel_SD_127.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

SparedIsobel_SD_133.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_133.text: We'll best this - just think positively. Or at least... don't think murderously.
SparedIsobel_SD_133.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

SparedIsobel_SD_197.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_197.text: Besides, there's plenty of foes out there for you to vent your impulses on.
SparedIsobel_SD_197.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

SparedIsobel_SD_140.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_140.text: I won't quite say that - far from it. But you and I have a bond. I can't let a little bloodlust ruin that.
SparedIsobel_SD_140.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

SparedIsobel_SD_188.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_188.text: I'm sure someone will write a romantic ballad about this one day - hopefully not a tragic one.
SparedIsobel_SD_188.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

SparedIsobel_SD_229.text: I've killed so many people. You should end me here and now.

SparedIsobel_SD_208.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_208.text: Well, it's always an option if we're out of ideas... but let's at least try to save you before it comes to that, hmm?
SparedIsobel_SD_208.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

SparedIsobel_SD_104.text: Tell the story, but lay heavy blame on the Butler.

SparedIsobel_SD_106.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_106.text: Gruesome-sounding wretch - not something I envy of you.
SparedIsobel_SD_106.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

SparedIsobel_SD_77.text: Recount your Urges, holding your past life responsible.

SparedIsobel_SD_147.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_147.text: That person's a stranger to me. Don't torment yourself with the past.
SparedIsobel_SD_147.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

SparedIsobel_SD_160.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_160.text: Growling? Come on, at least use words. You're better than this - fight it.
SparedIsobel_SD_160.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

SparedIsobel_SD_119.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_119.text: You can thank me once the bloodlust subsides. Keep focused.
SparedIsobel_SD_119.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] companion is sitting near the player as they are going through withdrawl, sitting position is differerent than when they just had woke. Its not a relaxed moment, establish a pose that refects that.

SparedIsobel_SD_223.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_223.text: *The maiming twitches consume you. You cannot talk.*

SparedIsobel_SD_42.text: Resist and try to express understanding.

SparedIsobel_SD_85.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_85.text: *Your jaw convulses, and you almost bite off your own tongue.*

SparedIsobel_SD_48.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_48.text: I'm going to kill the person I care most about: you. Unless you can stop me.

SparedIsobel_SD_179.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_179.text: I suppose I'm flattered - and alarmed.
SparedIsobel_SD_179.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Greg] .Companion should be in the sitting up pose after waking

SparedIsobel_SD_171.text: Oh... sorry. I just had a bad dream. Go back to sleep.

SparedIsobel_SD_37.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_37.text: All right, then... Maybe if it happens again, try pinching yourself.

SparedIsobel_SD_134.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_134.text: *You return to your bedroll, and sleep like the dead.*
SparedIsobel_SD_134.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black, companion will be dead the next morning.

SparedIsobel_SD_214.speaker: Player
SparedIsobel_SD_214.text: What the...? Hells, don't wake me like that. I was almost reaching for a weapon.
SparedIsobel_SD_214.context: CinematicNodeContext: [greg] The Companion awakens from their sleep.Choose an appropraite start sleeping position for character, sit up during line

SparedIsobel_SD_46.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_46.text: *As soon as you raise the dagger, all doubts disappear from your mind, replaced by pure pleasure.*
SparedIsobel_SD_46.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Dark Urge kills the companion in question

SparedIsobel_SD_199.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_199.text: *This is far more thrilling than your nights together ever could be.*

SparedIsobel_SD_182.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_182.text: *In the heat of the night, these last gasps are those of disappointment.*
SparedIsobel_SD_182.context:
CinematicNodeContext: TAV kills the companion

Screen goes RED - Dark Urge

SparedIsobel_SD_24.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_24.text: *With almost no struggle, she has gone out like a light.*
SparedIsobel_SD_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: *Tav glances over the dead body of the companion.*

SparedIsobel_SD_230.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_230.text: *You grant one last caress to your dead companion.*
SparedIsobel_SD_230.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black, fade to the morning

SparedIsobel_SD_228.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_228.text: Wake up the others - you may be a danger to all of them.

SparedIsobel_SD_163.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_163.text: *Thoughts flittering, you prepare to be hated.*
SparedIsobel_SD_163.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black, fade to the morning

SparedIsobel_SD_213.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_213.text: Remain for a while in the company of the corpse.

SparedIsobel_SD_15.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_15.text: *The corpse feels carefree, peaceful, and loving to linger beside.*

SparedIsobel_SD_180.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_180.text: *You drink in the sight until the dawn.*
SparedIsobel_SD_180.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black, fade to the morning

SparedIsobel_SD_145.text: Spend a while admiring the pretty corpse of your dead darling.

SparedIsobel_SD_120.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_120.text: *There is a beautiful blush on her cheeks that was never there while she was alive.*

SparedIsobel_SD_13.text: Leave and go back to sleep.

SparedIsobel_SD_102.speaker: Narrator
SparedIsobel_SD_102.text: *Surely it is preposterous anything else would happen tonight?*

SparedIsobel_SD_209.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_209.text: Your inheritance of your estate depends on you maintaining a healthy stream of kills.

SparedIsobel_SD_161.text: Perhaps I might be stronger without such sentimental attachments.

SparedIsobel_SD_177.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_177.text: You've judged my affections wrongly - I am much closer to Gale!

SparedIsobel_SD_43.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_43.text: I am much closer to Halsin!

SparedIsobel_SD_78.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_78.text: You've judged my affections wrongly - I am much closer to Jaheira!

SparedIsobel_SD_123.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_123.text: You've judged my affections wrongly - I am much closer to Minthara!

SparedIsobel_SD_152.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_152.text: You've judged my affections wrongly - I am much closer to Shadowheart!

SparedIsobel_SD_153.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_153.text: You've judged my affections wrongly - I am much closer to Wyll!

SparedIsobel_SD_74.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_74.text: You've judged my affections wrongly - I am much closer to Karlach!

SparedIsobel_SD_219.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_219.text: You've judged my affections wrongly - I am much closer to Lae'zel!

SparedIsobel_SD_164.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_164.text: You misunderstand - I don't care about her at all.

SparedIsobel_SD_58.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_58.text: So all those sweet words were said in the hope of lying with her? Hah! A fine performance, O my itching liege!

SparedIsobel_SD_158.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_158.text: Master, I am a professional. I've seen the two of you together. Every one of your darkest desires craves her.

SparedIsobel_SD_122.text: You misunderstand - I don't care about her at all.

SparedIsobel_SD_56.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_56.text: One of your station has no equal to call a friend.

SparedIsobel_SD_8.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_8.text: You can try to deceive me all you wish - you cannot deceive your own heart.

SparedIsobel_SD_157.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_157.text: Harming me will not aid her in the slightest. Nothing will at this point.
SparedIsobel_SD_157.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] The Butler rises to his feet, and lightly hops over the sleeping companion and bows in a groveling nature.

SparedIsobel_SD_113.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_113.text: He has his own devil, just as you have me. Aren't you a foul pair?
SparedIsobel_SD_113.context: CinematicNodeContext: Butler is crouched low beside the sleeping companion.

SparedIsobel_SD_40.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_40.text: He is so afraid. So, so afraid. Of everyone, besides you, who he ought to fear most.
SparedIsobel_SD_40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Butler is crouched low beside the sleeping companion.

SparedIsobel_SD_148.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_148.text: She came all the way to this world, just to die here.
SparedIsobel_SD_148.context: CinematicNodeContext: Butler is crouched low beside the sleeping companion.

SparedIsobel_SD_60.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_60.text: The gods fight over her, but is she truly that special?
SparedIsobel_SD_60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Butler is crouched low beside the sleeping companion.

SparedIsobel_SD_222.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_222.text: She thinks she is finally away from the monsters. Poor fool.
SparedIsobel_SD_222.context: CinematicNodeContext: Butler is crouched low beside the sleeping companion.

SparedIsobel_SD_186.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_186.text: He thinks he might end the world. But you and I could do far worse.
SparedIsobel_SD_186.context: CinematicNodeContext: Butler is crouched low beside the sleeping companion.

SparedIsobel_SD_144.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_144.text: There comes a time where every precious young Master must triumph over scrutiny.

SparedIsobel_SD_9.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_9.text: Had you excelled instead of resisted, you would have received a disgusting Prize already. But it's not too late yet.

SparedIsobel_SD_114.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_114.text: Your perfect instincts force your knife-arm. You know that well from the bard.

SparedIsobel_SD_4.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_4.text: You will do something divinely unspeakable on this eve.

SparedIsobel_SD_111.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_111.text: Your betters are no fans of the company you've been keeping...

SparedIsobel_SD_181.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_181.text: At last! I've found the prodigal! And in what a sorry state, without your Butler to guide you.

SparedIsobel_SD_101.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_101.text: I wish I'd discovered you drinking yourself to death in a tavern with some bedfellows of negotiable virtue, and not this debacle.

SparedIsobel_SD_237.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_237.text: But worry not, your loyal Butler Sceleritas Fel is here, ready to get you back to behaving like a fellow of your fine breeding ought.

SparedIsobel_SD_125.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_125.text: What in the hells do you mean you're my Butler?

SparedIsobel_SD_192.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_192.text: I also tend to your grounds, manage your estate, arrange murder victims for you to systematically brutalise, and serve dinner.

SparedIsobel_SD_54.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_54.text: Oh, rather. Can't you tell how the Urge is thickening? You have been altogether too good to appease it.

SparedIsobel_SD_183.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_183.text: I tried time again to find you, after you became indisposed. Your inheritance is waiting, and I am waiting to grant it to you, if you do one little thing.

SparedIsobel_SD_19.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_19.text: Do you know who I am?

SparedIsobel_SD_100.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_100.text: Ah yes - the memory problem. I'm afraid I'm not allowed to interfere but know you had the thirstiest knife-arm in the Coast, before you were stolen away from my side.

SparedIsobel_SD_217.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_217.text: Now, on to the matter at hand.

SparedIsobel_SD_173.text: I think I'll slit your throat.

SparedIsobel_SD_63.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
SparedIsobel_SD_63.text: Oh, Master! Still as thirsty as ever. But tonight you should concentrate your efforts on another.

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_5.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_5.text: *You open your eyes with a lurch, and you are not in your bed.*
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player jolts into consciousness, They look around and quickly spot a mutliated corpse on the ground in front of them, before realizing they themselves are covered in blood.<CodyM>

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_54.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_54.text: *You stand above a body, which is in a state of gore nearly beyond recognition.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_48.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_48.text: *The body of that brave girl, who earnestly swore to devote her life to your cause.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_76.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_76.text: *Her blood covers you, and its warmth feels like the embrace of an old friend.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_56.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_56.text: *You recall nothing of how you ended up here, but your head pounds and aches.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_10.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_10.text: Attend to the body - something must be done about it.

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_0.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_0.text: Try hard to remember something, anything.

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_62.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_62.text: *The flash of abject terror in her eyes.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_25.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_25.text: *Blood spilling from her lips. No time for last words.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_64.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_64.text: *The throbbing in your skull will hardly let you think, let alone remember.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_7.text: Investigate your surroundings, looking for an explanation.

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_14.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_14.text: *There are dozens and dozens of wounds on the corpse. The killer did not stop savaging it, even when she was long gone.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_28.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_28.text: *And your dominant arm aches. It aches from stabbing. Over and over.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_18.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_18.text: *No matter how it appears, the body is there, and her blood is on your hands.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_9.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_9.text: *The question flows through your mind: who are you, really, that you could be guilty of such bitter business?*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_59.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_59.text: Wonder: what curse is in your heart, to kill in your sleep?

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_39.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_39.text: *The contemptible pervert within must have lavished slash after slash upon the girl.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_29.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_29.text: *But where, oh where could that monster have come from? If only you knew yourself better.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_17.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_17.text: Push the thoughts away - you'd rather not know.

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_78.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_78.text: *You may wish to hide from your past, and your Urges.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_66.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_66.text: *But this body says it all... your desires for cruelty will not hide from you.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_45.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_45.text: Refuse to believe this was your doing.

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_6.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_6.text: *You should face the problem at hand.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_2.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_2.text: *If you could craft a corpse like this in one night, what masterpieces have you sculpted in your forgotten decades?*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_12.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_12.text: *You don't have much time for reflection now, you need to act.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_55.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_55.text: *Someone is sure to see the evidence of this darling sin.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_43.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_43.text: Seek out the nearest water to wash the blood away.

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_51.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_51.text: *You scrub yourself until your hands are cold and raw.*
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_51.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player kneels before a bucket, reaches in to grab a sponge. We see their worried face and hear splashing.

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_50.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_50.text: *You can tell the blood is washing away, but your heart mourns its loss so dearly.*
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark Urge turns away, clean once again.

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_32.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_32.text: *While your body starts to feel clean, the blood doesn't seem to leave.*
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Blood does not wash off of the Dark Urge

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_20.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_20.text: *After a few moments more of scrubbing, your hands begin to sting.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_36.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_36.text: *But her blood is still on your hands, surely?*
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_36.context: CinematicNodeContext: TAV examines a part of their body, which is immaculately clean.

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_41.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_41.text: *You shake your head, and it seems to go away, only then.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_67.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_67.text: *If you are fortunate, no soul will be able to know you were behind this murder.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_35.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_35.text: *You wonder if your misdeed will be noticed.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_68.text: Examine the blood more closely - is it magical?

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_57.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_57.text: *There is no magic binding this blood to your body, only guilt.*
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_57.context: CinematicNodeContext: TAV examines a part of their body, which is immaculately clean.

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_74.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_74.text: *There is something intangible which stops the blood from leaving you.*
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_74.context: CinematicNodeContext: TAV examines a part of their body, which is immaculately clean.

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_4.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_4.text: *A light and delicate girl. It should be no trouble at all to toss her into a ditch.*
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Dark Urge anxiously looks around the camp to check no one else is awake

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_53.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_53.text: *You roll her away, further bloodying your hands as you do.*
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reaching down, to drag the offscreen corpse away.<CodyM>

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_71.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_71.text: *In lumbering style, you have gotten away with murder.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_38.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_38.text: *Her guts start to spill and flow everywhere as you shift her.*
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reaching down, to drag the offscreen corpse away.<CodyM>

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_80.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_80.text: Prepare to face the others - you aren't going to hide.

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_30.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_30.text: *Your misdeed is bright and clear as the dawning day.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_22.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_22.text: *The bedroll becomes a warm, swampy cocoon of gall and fluids.*
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: TAV returns to their bedroll, still covered in gore,

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_63.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_63.text: *You may only have a few moments before the others awaken, and begin to cast blame for the hot sin before you.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_23.text: Connect to your parasite, is it responsible?

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_46.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_46.text: *Your companions sleep blissfully tonight. If it were the rage of a tadpole, no others seem to be affected.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_27.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_27.text: *There is nothing else here, and no one else around.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_79.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_79.text: *You and the corpse seem to have been alone together for quite some time.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_73.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_73.text: *The body of that scared girl, who asked for nothing more than a night of shelter.*

MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_42.speaker: Narrator
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_42.text: *You open your eyes with a lurch, and you are not in your bed.*
MurderOfAlfira_SD_BloodOnHands_42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player jolts into consciousness, They look around and quickly spot a mutliated corpse on the ground in front of them, before realizing they themselves are covered in blood.<CodyM>

KilledIsobel_SD_23.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_23.text: Oh! Bravo! Bravo! You are growing up to be a fine fellow of the most degraded calibre.

KilledIsobel_SD_21.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_21.text: The cleric and Last Light, all are now but an ichored slagheap.

KilledIsobel_SD_103.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_103.text: And it was all your own work! You didn't even need your Butler's advice: you have acted with the utmost decorum. First the bard, now this triumph!

KilledIsobel_SD_17.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_17.text: Don't worry, Master, I will ensure you have a diverse roster of victims from now on. Hapless menfolk deserve death just as much as the girlies.

KilledIsobel_SD_65.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_65.text: It would damage your reputation if the fearing public thought you a predator. After all, you're far worse than one of those base lusty spree-killers.

KilledIsobel_SD_11.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_11.text: I was worried when you didn't kill the silly bard I sent for you to play with, but forgive my lack of faith - I only had your best interests at heart.

KilledIsobel_SD_22.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_22.text: Oh, I rather got carried away there, wherever are my manners? Sceleritas Fel, your undyingly loyal servant, your Butler, before our separation.

KilledIsobel_SD_114.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_114.text: What in the Hells do you mean, you're my Butler?

KilledIsobel_SD_19.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_19.text: Oh, my itching Liege, it hurts to hear you recall me not! I had indeed heard rumours you had become indisposed.

KilledIsobel_SD_35.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_35.text: You know who I was, before I lost my memories?

KilledIsobel_SD_71.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_71.text: Oh don't say it like that, you're clearly the same-old knife-happy lunatic I have loved ever-long!

KilledIsobel_SD_1.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_1.text: Your little indisposition has not been able to get rid of what's on the inside. The evil in your rotten heart.

KilledIsobel_SD_13.text: The whole time I was killing... you were watching?

KilledIsobel_SD_121.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_121.text: I fear you are over-working yourself, for I was earnestly trying to find a moment to help set you on the right path, but you were just frolicking away with your dagger, weren't you?

KilledIsobel_SD_51.speaker: Narrator
KilledIsobel_SD_51.text: *Your kill of your poor friend can only mean one thing. The degraded Sceleritas will be back soon enough.*
KilledIsobel_SD_51.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Dark Urge doesn't go to sleep when the companions do, but waits up at the side of the camp. The BUTLER appears behind them.

KilledIsobel_SD_78.speaker: Narrator
KilledIsobel_SD_78.text: *Your mind is heavy. The devastation of Last Light is sure to pique the interest of the vile Sceleritas.*
KilledIsobel_SD_78.context: InternalNodeContext: This should be if you killed NS and accidentally caused the village of Haven to be destroyed.

KilledIsobel_SD_87.speaker: Narrator
KilledIsobel_SD_87.text: *Your kill of that poor cleric can mean only one thing: the vile Sceleritas will be here soon enough.*
KilledIsobel_SD_87.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Dark Urge doesn't go to sleep when the companions do, but waits up at the side of the camp. The BUTLER appears behind them.

KilledIsobel_SD_97.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_97.text: Pray that he was defeated in the attack.

KilledIsobel_SD_6.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_6.text: Alive again! Sceleritas always comes back. He could never leave his odious liege!

KilledIsobel_SD_102.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_102.text: Tap your foot impatiently, a butler should be on time!

KilledIsobel_SD_120.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_120.text: Apologies for the tardiness, my festering liege.

KilledIsobel_SD_18.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_18.text: I was away admiring her body. I have never seen a torn tibia quite like that!

KilledIsobel_SD_85.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_85.text: A part of your past is here for you. I come with your disgusting Prize.

KilledIsobel_SD_98.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_98.text: Quickly, give it to me. I don't want anyone seeing.

KilledIsobel_SD_79.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_79.text: Oh, soon enough everyone in the Sword Coast and beyond will know about you.

KilledIsobel_SD_43.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_43.text: But you yearn for the sordid scandal deep down, don't you?

KilledIsobel_SD_113.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_113.context: CinematicNodeContext: *The Butler casts an effect to impart the SLAYER FORM upon the DARK URGE*

KilledIsobel_SD_70.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_70.text: Try on your new jimjams! They're a present from Father, it would be rude not to.
KilledIsobel_SD_70.context: CinematicNodeContext: The DARK URGE turns into the SLAYER

KilledIsobel_SD_64.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_64.text: Ooh! Such a strapping young behemoth!

KilledIsobel_SD_100.speaker: Narrator
KilledIsobel_SD_100.text: *You cannot speak, but you have command over your own cruelty.*

KilledIsobel_SD_73.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_73.context: CinematicNodeContext: Roaring emerges from the Slayer

KilledIsobel_SD_63.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_63.text: Do not be afraid, my tainted angel.
KilledIsobel_SD_63.context: CinematicNodeContext: Roaring emerges from the Slayer

KilledIsobel_SD_30.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_30.text: Sceleritas will ensure you stay in harm's way.

KilledIsobel_SD_84.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_84.text: Force yourself back into your natural form.

KilledIsobel_SD_46.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_46.text: Focus on your breathing. Release this murderous shape.

KilledIsobel_SD_40.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_40.text: Try to suppress the beast's rage.

KilledIsobel_SD_91.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_91.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Slayer swipes at the butler. Butler is getting really into it, perhaps shaking his hips and squirming with glee.

KilledIsobel_SD_26.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_26.text: Don't be cruel! Don't leave incy wincy Sceleritas on edge like that!

KilledIsobel_SD_5.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_5.text: It's been so long since you last killed me.

KilledIsobel_SD_56.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_56.text: Please. Please. I know you have the iniquity within you.

KilledIsobel_SD_36.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_36.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Slayer swipes and kills the Butler, Sceleritas goes flying into the air, ragdolling at immense speed.NodeContext: A slightly orgasmic death groan.

KilledIsobel_SD_82.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Another Sceleritas is swiftly created in front of you, with a glow, he appears again.

KilledIsobel_SD_54.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_54.text: Thank you. Your claws hit like a kiss.

KilledIsobel_SD_47.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_47.text: Every death brings a new, brighter, better Sceleritas into this world.

KilledIsobel_SD_48.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_48.text: You would be lost without your Butler, but you shall never be without me.

KilledIsobel_SD_119.text: Take command and return to yourself.

KilledIsobel_SD_4.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_4.text: And look at you! Now you're your perfect self again.

KilledIsobel_SD_101.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_101.text: This form is the Slayer. You will do many naughty feats with it.

KilledIsobel_SD_83.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_83.text: I wish I had been blessed with a few more moments of ogling, but the Slayer will be back soon.

KilledIsobel_SD_117.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_117.text: Glorious! I shall do my best to honour its brutality.

KilledIsobel_SD_25.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_25.text: It sparkles resplendently! I shall be back after your next triumph.

KilledIsobel_SD_110.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_110.text: You are going to kill again soon. You will keep chopping down the Moonmaiden's family tree.

KilledIsobel_SD_67.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_67.text: I shall return when you next have need of me.

KilledIsobel_SD_96.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_96.text: I have your estate to attend to, we will meet again there. Good night, sweet Master.

KilledIsobel_SD_38.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_38.text: I tire of killing, please, let me be free.

KilledIsobel_SD_31.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_31.text: There are endless combinations of moral atrocities ready to be penned.

KilledIsobel_SD_41.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_41.text: If you ever feel you're losing your spark, I would recommend breaking a few taboos.

KilledIsobel_SD_94.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_94.text: A bit of infanticide here and a touch of cannibalism there are sure to inspire you again.

KilledIsobel_SD_111.text: You're going to tell me everything about my lineage, or else!

KilledIsobel_SD_45.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_45.text: There is nothing you can do to me I would not enjoy.

KilledIsobel_SD_58.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_58.text: And there is nothing you can do to thwart yourself. You are perfection.

KilledIsobel_SD_61.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_61.text: But you should be hopeful for your bright future!

KilledIsobel_SD_76.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_76.text: I wish I had time to wax your hide and brush your spines, but your adoring Butler must away.
KilledIsobel_SD_76.context: CinematicNodeContext: PLAYER TURNS BACK INTO HUMANOID FORM ON THIS NODE

KilledIsobel_SD_112.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_112.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Slayer swipes and kills the Butler, Sceleritas goes flying into the air, ragdolling at immense speed.NodeContext: A slightly orgasmic death groan.

KilledIsobel_SD_7.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_7.text: I hope you will consider killing me in future, Master.

KilledIsobel_SD_92.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_92.text: I'll take your sugary trinket, but my killing comes from pure desire.

KilledIsobel_SD_93.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_93.text: This Prize is no payment, but a sign of reverence towards you.

KilledIsobel_SD_0.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_0.text: I don't want it, it clearly wasn't enough to save me before.

KilledIsobel_SD_57.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_57.text: You didn't have it before, but wished for it. I was pained to watch you pine and pine!

KilledIsobel_SD_42.text: If it's from my old life, I don't want anything to do with it.

KilledIsobel_SD_69.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_69.text: Your past and future are avowed life-long lovers.

KilledIsobel_SD_105.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_105.text: Fantasise about the dark prize you will soon receive.

KilledIsobel_SD_74.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_74.text: Mmmm, I have something wonderful for you, dear mouldering Master.

KilledIsobel_SD_86.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_86.text: Fret in fear - will you ever be free of him?

KilledIsobel_SD_34.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_34.text: Excellent work with the Cleric, but we are only now getting started.

KilledIsobel_SD_60.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_60.text: Excellent betrayal the other night! I could not have backstabbed better myself!

KilledIsobel_SD_29.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_29.text: My crumbs of doubt in you were most unjust. You killed your darling! Encore!

KilledIsobel_SD_49.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_49.text: Mourn your deeds. You regret them all.

KilledIsobel_SD_77.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_77.text: No! Don't be sad, Master! I am here to give you a happy present!

KilledIsobel_SD_3.text: Yawn. You're missing your sleep waiting up for him.

KilledIsobel_SD_122.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
KilledIsobel_SD_122.text: Oh! Milord is tired! I will tuck them in personally, with a bedtime story of their former self.

Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_10.speaker: Narrator
Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_10.text: *Memories flood back - snatches of your story, written in the blood of a thousand victims.*
Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Dark Urge wakes up from their dream and is back in camp

Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_42.speaker: Narrator
Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_42.text: *Years spent in worship of Bhaal, leading his savage congregation in prayer, sacrifice, and slaughter.*

Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_39.speaker: Narrator
Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_39.text: *You were their Master, and he was yours. A cruel Master, a Dread Lord... a devoted Father.*

Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_44.speaker: Narrator
Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_44.text: *All is greater than you could have dreamed. You are a spawn of Bhaal - his heir, his scion.*
Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player sits up, still reeling

Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_23.speaker: Narrator
Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_23.text: Shudder. This has gone too far.

Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_28.speaker: Narrator
Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_28.text: *If you want to be free of your Urge, you must confront your past.*

Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_16.speaker: Narrator
Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_16.text: Revel in the memories of murder.

Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_31.speaker: Narrator
Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_31.text: *The cruelty of the Slayer leaps around within.*

Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_25.speaker: Narrator
Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_25.text: *Dear sister must die by your hand, an offering in Bhaal's sanctum.*

Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_18.speaker: Narrator
Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_18.text: *Your heart pines for the love of your Lord.*

Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_19.speaker: Narrator
Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_19.text: *Today is a wonderful day for murder.*
Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark Urge will always transform back into normal form in gameplay the second this cutscene is over.

Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_33.text: Recall that there was another - the woman beneath your feet.

Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_6.speaker: Narrator
Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_6.text: *You are not the last of your name. Not yet.*

Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_46.speaker: Narrator
Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_46.text: *This is the truth lost in your mangled memories. You are a spawn of Bhaal - his heir, his scion.*
Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player sits up, still reeling

Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_14.speaker: Narrator
Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_14.text: *All is as you feared. You are a spawn of Bhaal - his heir, his scion.*
Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player sits up, still reeling

Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_41.speaker: Narrator
Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_41.text: Tense up. That may be what you were, but it is not who you are.

Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_20.speaker: Narrator
Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_20.text: *And yet you know you will never be free of your Urge if you don't confront your past.*

Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_21.speaker: Narrator
Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_21.text: Surrender to the Urge. Perhaps it is time to embrace your heritage.

Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_35.text: All those deaths by your hand. How can you ever atone?

Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_2.speaker: Narrator
Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_2.text: *There is another. The abomination wrapped in flesh you saw in the colony. Orin.*

Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_45.speaker: Narrator
Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_45.text: *But be wary of your confessors. Will friend turn to foe, knowing what you are?*

Bloodwedding_SD_Nested_InWorld_38.text: Recall that there was another - the woman who became the Slayer.

ButlerIntro_SD_50.speaker: Narrator
ButlerIntro_SD_50.text: *The blood running through you feels so thick, you can hear your arteries screaming as your restless body twitches.*
ButlerIntro_SD_50.context: CinematicNodeContext: |The Dark Urge awakens with a start.|

ButlerIntro_SD_59.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_59.text: Oh, sweet Master, you're shivering! You'll get sick if you don't have your sweetmeats!

ButlerIntro_SD_39.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_39.text: It is too sad, I am too late! The conditions were all set up for the perfect crime, and your precious knife-arm didn't take the bait!

ButlerIntro_SD_54.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_54.text: You were meant to kill the bard, my Liege. Then throw her into a ditch, river, pit, bog, or whathaveyou.

ButlerIntro_SD_28.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_28.text: At least I'm here now, to direct you towards further atrocities worthy of your station. You truly have been lost without your Butler, haven't you?

ButlerIntro_SD_7.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_7.text: What in the Hells do you mean, you're my butler?

ButlerIntro_SD_32.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_32.text: Fear not, I have arranged your affairs in your absence. You shall wake up to her putrefied carcass. Breakfast in bed!

ButlerIntro_SD_81.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_81.text: Ah, I can tell Master's mind has experienced a bit of treacle since last we met.

ButlerIntro_SD_65.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_65.text: You are a fellow of fine breeding... you shall have your chance to indulge again soon enough. And there will be a great Prize when you do.

ButlerIntro_SD_41.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_41.text: At least the bard is gone now, I promise I will not speak of this little embarrassment again.

ButlerIntro_SD_37.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_37.text: I was so worried for your health during our long separation. Master, you should really take better care of yourself.

ButlerIntro_SD_72.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_72.text: It isn't good for you to go this long without garrotting little girls.

ButlerIntro_SD_77.text: That's insane. Of course I wasn't going to kill her!

ButlerIntro_SD_87.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_87.text: Rotted One? Pardon? I don't wish to overstep myself in saying so, but you seem rather not yourself.

ButlerIntro_SD_23.text: My head is sick, very sick. Do you know about it?

ButlerIntro_SD_69.speaker: Narrator
ButlerIntro_SD_69.text: *Tonight, you can't chase the thoughts of that poor girl you killed from your head.*
ButlerIntro_SD_69.context: CinematicNodeContext: Tav is tossing in their sleep, and the sound of many screams in unison fills their head.

ButlerIntro_SD_53.speaker: Narrator
ButlerIntro_SD_53.text: *You wonder what she looked like as she died. Squirming, skewered, in abject agony.*

ButlerIntro_SD_22.speaker: Narrator
ButlerIntro_SD_22.text: *You would have given anything to have seen it.*

ButlerIntro_SD_27.speaker: Narrator
ButlerIntro_SD_27.text: *As you jolt awake, too many questions plague you.*

ButlerIntro_SD_42.context: CinematicNodeContext: TAV gets up and goes to a secluded part of the camp

ButlerIntro_SD_38.speaker: Narrator
ButlerIntro_SD_38.text: *When the proud deed of her death was yours, why do you have no recollection of it?*
ButlerIntro_SD_38.context: CinematicNodeContext: The BUTLER lurks behind Tav, we hear a little giggle. Tav doesn't see him yet.

ButlerIntro_SD_3.text: Go for a walk, to try and stop yourself from retching.

ButlerIntro_SD_85.context: CinematicNodeContext: Tav gets out of bed, trying to clear their head

ButlerIntro_SD_82.speaker: Narrator
ButlerIntro_SD_82.text: *Your body barely complies; you feel such rushes from your thoughts of the dead woman.*
ButlerIntro_SD_82.context: CinematicNodeContext: The BUTLER lurks behind Tav, we hear a little giggle. Tav doesn't see him yet.

ButlerIntro_SD_4.speaker: Narrator
ButlerIntro_SD_4.text: *Why did she die? The mystery gnaws at your pounding heart.*

ButlerIntro_SD_55.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_55.text: O most royal one! Jubilant day! I have found your vile self at last!
ButlerIntro_SD_55.context: CinematicNodeContext: TAV notices the butler behind them for the first time and turns to face him

ButlerIntro_SD_49.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_49.text: Sceleritas Fel. Your loyal and ever-adoring butler.

ButlerIntro_SD_17.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_17.text: I followed you, my dear rotted Master. We have been parted so tragically long.

ButlerIntro_SD_61.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_61.text: What in the Hells do you mean, you're my butler?

ButlerIntro_SD_6.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_6.text: One Hell of a Butler, the most unprincipled servant you could hope for.

ButlerIntro_SD_68.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_68.text: You have always struggled to conduct yourself properly without me.

ButlerIntro_SD_89.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_89.text: About damned time someone respected my godlike depravity!

ButlerIntro_SD_86.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_86.text: My lordly reprobate! I missed you ever-so.

ButlerIntro_SD_36.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_36.text: I was so worried for your health during our long separation. Now I found you, silly me, my fears were unfounded.

ButlerIntro_SD_67.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_67.text: You have kept killing without me. That will keep you fighting fit and healthy.

ButlerIntro_SD_0.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_0.text: I'm in a nightmare, aren't I?

ButlerIntro_SD_16.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_16.text: We are in a place darker than any prison, hotter than any fire, where the souls of the innocent scream in sacred agony...

ButlerIntro_SD_90.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_90.text: Your flayed and putrefied heart. Thump. Thump.

ButlerIntro_SD_84.text: My head is sick, very sick. Do you know about it?

ButlerIntro_SD_12.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_12.text: Ooft! I had heard of Master's indisposition, but I had hoped the rumours were untrue.

ButlerIntro_SD_44.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_44.text: No matter, we will get you back to committing five villainous acts before breakfast in no time!

ButlerIntro_SD_13.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_13.text: I found you, following the stench of that bard. She reeked across the coast like a piece of dog-muck on the road.

ButlerIntro_SD_40.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_40.text: I can still smell her gore, too. What a fair perfume.

ButlerIntro_SD_33.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_33.text: My, my. We will be reintroducing necrophilia to your schedule in no time.

ButlerIntro_SD_20.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_20.text: Did you cause me to kill her?

ButlerIntro_SD_5.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_5.text: Such fine work could never be done by a wretch like me!

ButlerIntro_SD_79.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_79.text: Anyways, I come once again bearing a part of your dreadful inheritance.
ButlerIntro_SD_79.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Butler waves a hand, there is an effect where the Dark Urge is presented with an item: S_ORI_DarkUrge_CloakReward_88ddc51d-2f1c-4871-9c5b-550ff0437cfc, which appears on the ground in front of the butler as an offering.NodeContext: The Butler waves a hand,

ButlerIntro_SD_31.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_31.text: You earned this iniquitous prize through your great show of exceptional violence the other night.

ButlerIntro_SD_57.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_57.text: I'm sure Master will be better soon. A fellow of your fine breeding is never down for long.

ButlerIntro_SD_74.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_74.text: I cannot wait until your next act of shameless barbarity.

ButlerIntro_SD_64.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_64.text: Oh, my sanguine Master! I Your next work will be wonderful.

ButlerIntro_SD_56.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_56.text: It will be hard to improve upon what you have already done - I am a great admirer of what you did with the bard's left carotid artery.

ButlerIntro_SD_58.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_58.text: But I am certain inspiration will strike!

ButlerIntro_SD_1.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_1.text: You're going to tell me everything about my past life.

ButlerIntro_SD_2.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_2.text: Though I would love to regale you with your past triumphs, I cannot.

ButlerIntro_SD_35.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_35.text: I am forbidden to interfere. Our betters will not allow it.

ButlerIntro_SD_71.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_71.text: There will be no more barbarity!

ButlerIntro_SD_26.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_26.text: Death wants everything to do with you, good villain.

ButlerIntro_SD_76.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_76.text: Not likely. I am already disgusted at myself for killing her.

ButlerIntro_SD_70.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_70.text: Oh, it was wonderfully disgusting, wasn't it?

ButlerIntro_SD_29.text: This prize isn't from my tadpole, is it?

ButlerIntro_SD_45.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_45.text: Pay no mind to it. We have been with you, always. And always by your side, we will remain.

ButlerIntro_SD_66.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_66.text: I didn't kill her! It happened while I was asleep!

ButlerIntro_SD_24.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_24.text: Ah yes, Master has always had some spontaneous little outbursts of joy.

ButlerIntro_SD_47.text: It was bliss to kill her in front of everyone.

ButlerIntro_SD_83.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
ButlerIntro_SD_83.text: It seems you've become quite the exhibitionist without me. I can only congratulate you on your indecency.

ButlerIntro_SD_18.speaker: Narrator
ButlerIntro_SD_18.text: *She was only seeking your protection? What compelled you to end her?*

ButlerIntro_SD_80.speaker: Narrator
ButlerIntro_SD_80.text: *How many lives did you ruin already, before the crash?*

Bloodwedding_SD_18.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
Bloodwedding_SD_18.text: Triumph after triumph, you have excelled in base villainy.
Bloodwedding_SD_18.context:
CinematicNodeContext:  Orin beckons the DU closer.The Dark Urge approaches the altar.
[MK] - Player wakes, sits up into focus and is confronted by the image of the temple. Slowly stands up while looking around. End of shot their eyes lock onto something high off screen.

Bloodwedding_SD_33.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
Bloodwedding_SD_33.text: For one who fights with monsters should look to it that they themselves become a monster.
Bloodwedding_SD_33.context: CinematicNodeContext: [MK] - Push in on insignia of Bhaal skull to show what player is looking at... On dialogue "becomes a monster" the eyes burst into flames casting lightNodeContext: This is the original intro line from Baldur's Gate 1 - great emphasis should be placed upon it.

Bloodwedding_SD_0.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
Bloodwedding_SD_0.text: When you gaze long into the abyss the abyss also gazes into you.
Bloodwedding_SD_0.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The eyes of the insignia of Bhaal at the back of the temple light up, glowering over you and Orin.
[MK] MCU Player reacts, then glances down to see Orin on altar playing with the dagger "...into the abyss..", 
Orin looks up locking eyes with player after/on line "...the abyss also gazes into you"NodeContext: This is the second intro line from baldur's gate 1, if anything is a time-honoured truth espoused by the Butler, it's this.

Bloodwedding_SD_69.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
Bloodwedding_SD_69.text: You have reached the time of majority, and you shall come into your birthright.
Bloodwedding_SD_69.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The Dark Urge's body starts to transform, once Bhaal's icon has lit up.
[MK] - Orin rolls/spins off the altar, raising dagger to player.

Bloodwedding_SD_14.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
Bloodwedding_SD_14.text: But another seeks to disinherit you. Do not let her be your death.
Bloodwedding_SD_14.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The Dark Urge becomes the Slayer
[MK] - frame in as they square off against eachother. Cut to DU as they become slayer form

Bloodwedding_SD_43.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
Bloodwedding_SD_43.text: Your Father loves you best. You have already made us so proud.
Bloodwedding_SD_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Dark Urge steps on Orin while they are in slayer form. Orin snarls, and protests.

Bloodwedding_SD_26.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
Bloodwedding_SD_26.text: Slaughter your line. Become the last of your name.
